channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Check Out the Best From This Week's Open Thread
item.description:
• How can I store a large amount of movies and put them on a wireless external hard drive?
  • What is the best way to use a Chromebox for a home media center?
  • Where can I find the best SSD and how can I set it up?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Remember to Clean Door Handles and Switches When Someone Gets Sick
item.description:
No matter how healthy your family is, occasionally they'll get sick. Often that means the rest of the house gets sick. Covering your mouth when you sneeze isn't enough. You'll want to disinfect common places people leave germs.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Yelp Is Just as Good As Michelin at Rating Expensive Restaurants
item.description:
Michelin's restaurant ratings are considered some of the most reliable and coveted. They're curated by experts, after all. Yelp, on the other hand, uses ratings from normal novices. It seems, though, that both sources tend to agree with each other—at least in New York.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Make Cookie Butter at Home with Four Ingredients
item.description:
Cookie butter, also called speculoos butter, is one of the most popular Trader Joe's items. If you don't have a Trader Joe's nearby, no worries: you can make it at home with just a few ingredients.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Score a $50 Gift Card & Bonus Accessories with the GoPro Hero4 Black
item.description:
The new GoPro Hero4 Black is a 4K-shooting beast of an action cam , and if you missed out on a few Black Friday bundle deals, you're in luck today.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister, Commerce Team to Lifehacker

item.title: Five Best Sites to Sell Your Stuff
item.description:
We've shown you how to get rid of your unwanted stuff for cash before, but when you're ready to sell, you have to pick the sites you want to list your used goods on. Some make selling easy, others take a big bite out of the profits, and others have huge communities eager to buy. This week we're looking at five of the best, based on your nominations.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Know the Right Suit and Shoes For Any Occasion With This Chart
item.description:
For those of us who wear jeans and t-shirts, the basics of suit fashion might pass us by. This chart helps men figure out which shoes and suit go with which occasion.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Save on the Kindle Fire HD (Plus the Kids Editions) For the Holidays
item.description:
Amazon is taking $25 off the Kindle Fire HD 7 today for anyone in need of a solid little tablet for the holidays.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister, Commerce Team to Lifehacker

item.title: This Week's Top Downloads
item.description:
Every week, we share a number of downloads for all platforms to help you get things done. Here were the top downloads from this week.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Ask for a Refund When You Register Your Car in Another State
item.description:
When you move to a new state, you're usually required to register your car in the new state. If you contact your old DMV, you might be able to get a refund on your registration fees.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Wait Until After the Party to Open Kids' Birthday Presents
item.description:
When you were a kid, you probably wanted to open your birthday presents right away. With lots of children, though, that takes up too much time. Bring the gifts home for later and let the kids enjoy the party.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Try These Replacements for Eggs In Your Favorite Recipes
item.description:
Baking recipes typically require eggs. If eggs aren't an option, you don't need to try new recipes. Depending on the dish, you may only need a few simple modifications.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Come Home for the Holidays as an Adult, Not a Kid
item.description:
When we visit our families over the holidays, other family members may fall back into old habits and old roles from childhood. For some of us, these dynamics aren't pleasant. To prevent this problem, remember that you are coming home as an adult, not the kid you used to be.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Wait for a Flight Change to Escape the Cancellation Fee
item.description:
It happens to the best of us: we need to change our flight plans, but the airline wants to charge you a hefty cancellation fee. You can avoid them if the airlines makes changes to their flight plans.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Work On Your “Big Goal” Daily to Advance Your Career
item.description:
Most of us have a long to-do list, and we've also got a few long term goals for a career. Even if you get busy, don't let a day go by without working on the latter.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: These 17 Cheap Bluetooth Speakers Make Great Gifts for Nearly Everyone
item.description:
If you still have anyone on your holiday shopping list, and aren't quite sure what to get them, Bluetooth speakers are always a safe bet. Even if they already own one, it's nice to have, say, one for the kitchen, another for the bathroom, maybe a third for the bedroom...you get the idea. Today only, Amazon is offering big savings on 17 different models, so you're sure to find one that you're looking for.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister, Commerce Team to Lifehacker

item.title: Top 10 Backups Everyone Should Have (Not Just Computer Backups)
item.description:
You've heard it a lot, but it bears repeating: you need to back up your computer , because your hard drive will fail one day. Beyond those file backups, though, are many other things we need to have a backup for—ranging from work and finances to personal needs.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Prevent Frequent Dusting by Turning On Your Blower
item.description:
For many of us, dusting is a never-ending chore. It seems as soon as you dust a surface, it's dirty again. The dust may be settling right back down on the surfaces. If you turn on your central HVAC blower, you'll prevent that.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Dave Greenbaum

item.title: Most Popular Hive Fives of 2014
item.description:
The Hive Five series is one of our most popular, and this year was a great year for it. We rounded up the best options in just about every possible category, from hardware to software to gadgets and peripherals. Here's a look at our best from the past year.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Why You Get a Crick In Your Neck (and How You Can Prevent It)
item.description:
Waking up with a crick in your neck is one of the worst ways to start your day. Turing your head hurts anywhere you look and the worst is that you have no idea why. Here's what causes it and what you can do to help yourself avoid it in the future.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan
